LONDON, Nov 9 (LPC) - UK investment company 3i Infrastructure has agreed a £400m sustainability-linked revolving credit facility, refinancing its existing £300m RCF, which was due to mature in April 2023.


The financing has a three-year maturity with two one-year extension options and includes a £200m accordion facility, in line with the previous facility.


The facility pays a margin over Sonia.


Aligned to the Loan Market Association’s Sustainability Linked Loan Principles, the margin will be adjusted depending on 3i Infrastructure’s performance against ESG targets.


All 3i Infrastructure portfolio companies are implementing sustainability strategies developed in 2020 and are gathering greenhouse gas emissions data, the company said.


The SLL is secured by a floating charge over the bank accounts of the company.


Covenants include a loan to value ratio.
